narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Katharine Sassandra Walter  Excellent. Very helpful and responsive.
Instructor: Katharine Sassandra Walter  Katherine was great
Instructor: Katharine Sassandra Walter  Incredibly responsive and helpful.
Instructor: Katharine Sassandra Walter  Katharine Walter

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I think the course need less lecture and more lab where we are guided to work directly with R. That is the only way to learn statistics.

J.R.S. is an incredible teacher who is extremely good at explaining concepts, is extremely patient, and extremely available. His organization of the material into a path that he takes us down in an entertaining way is a highlight of my Yale education.T.G.G. is an extremely nice man who just doesn't present the complex concepts in a way that is easy to grasp. Discussing things with him outside of lecture is more helpful, but I would have really appreciated it if he made more effort to describe the issues that he covered in lecture in a more palatable way. I often wanted to raise my hand and ask 'what are you talking about?' Explaining the objective of a lecture in plain english - both in the notes and verbally (not just a reference to a statistics term or an R function) - at the beginning, middle, and end of the lecture would have been very helpful.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The enthusiasm of the instructors.
J.R.S's lectures and notes.
JRDS's lectures.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: The lack of clarity in the direction of the material and the lack of practical knowledge.
a few well-crafted graded homeworks
I would have liked a couple more, short homework assignments to keep me on track with the lecture material.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Katharine Sassandra Walter  She should lead more labs.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Because the topics are very interesting andI hope to apply them in my future research
I wanted to learn new analytical tools for economics data with spatial information.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: More or less. I would always like to know more but it's hard to say if more could have reasonably been fit into the semester
Yes, they did. I learned some new ways to approach data analysis if there is a spatial component involved.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: It was fun to tackle different elements of a spatial dataset together.

Definitely a great experience, we helped each other a lot, we got more work done and saw more results. Where one of us didn't understand, the other usually would. We had more ideas than we would have alone. We kept each other motivated.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Don't unless you already have a defined research question in spatial statistics that this course will help you work in.

Be prepared to be very very self-motivated. There's a lot you can get out of the time with the instructors and the time you give yourself to apply what's discussed in the lectures if you're deliberate about making it happen.

This is a very self-directed class. You need to have a clear reason and motivation for taking this course, otherwise, you will not get much out of it. I recommend asking Prof. JDRS prior to taking it if you think you are interested, explaining to him what you WANT to get out of it.
